snippet.textDisplay:
All comments when you complete the game:

1) Government ending (worst one)
“Thank you for playing”

2) Suzu and grandpa ending
Suzu: “If only everyone had survived”

3) Civilians ending
“Congratulations”

4) Kurou ending 
Tesshin : “I wished We had more elite swordsmen”

5) Akadama Clan ending
Kitcho : “So, the Akadama Clan wasn’t strong enough to resist the government?!”

6) Samurai allegiance ending (best one)
“CONGRATULATIONS”
snippet.textOriginal:
All comments when you complete the game:

1) Government ending (worst one)
“Thank you for playing”

2) Suzu and grandpa ending
Suzu: “If only everyone had survived”

3) Civilians ending
“Congratulations”

4) Kurou ending 
Tesshin : “I wished We had more elite swordsmen”

5) Akadama Clan ending
Kitcho : “So, the Akadama Clan wasn’t strong enough to resist the government?!”

6) Samurai allegiance ending (best one)
“CONGRATULATIONS”

snippet.textDisplay:
I've so many words, yet none to say.. I have added this song unto a great compilation, a means of listening to music if Internet and electricity grids burn away.. I feel a great Struggle coming. Next all I need is the solar panel outlet charger I ordered, and I'm set. All I need is some music. 

As for the Struggle.. don't you feel it? The world is terrifying.
snippet.textOriginal:
I've so many words, yet none to say.. I have added this song unto a great compilation, a means of listening to music if Internet and electricity grids burn away.. I feel a great Struggle coming. Next all I need is the solar panel outlet charger I ordered, and I'm set. All I need is some music. 

As for the Struggle.. don't you feel it? The world is terrifying.

snippet.textDisplay: I agree, when the age of the sword passed, so to did the age of the samurai.  I just beat the game and after seeing the ending (ending 5) my first thought is that it was very tragic, my second was that this truly was a samurai epic, I kinda think a movie should be made, though the effect would diminish, and it might be handed to someone who totally messes it up, but if a movie was made well, then it could be awesome.

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm getting annoyed by this. First and foremost, Way of the Samurai is a work of FICTION. It's not supposed to be taken seriously.

Second, Don took up the sword and enployed more than just skill and technique to his fighting. He fought with passion and cared deeply for Suzu and Kurikichi, the down-trodden and innocent. I think it is because of his passion that he was a true samurai.
snippet.textOriginal:
I'm getting annoyed by this. First and foremost, Way of the Samurai is a work of FICTION. It's not supposed to be taken seriously.

Second, Don took up the sword and enployed more than just skill and technique to his fighting. He fought with passion and cared deeply for Suzu and Kurikichi, the down-trodden and innocent. I think it is because of his passion that he was a true samurai.

snippet.textDisplay: I doubt this game is that serious, it's probably not a historical thing. I mean even IF a black guy went to Japan back then, he wouldn't be a samurai, you don't just have a sword and say you're a samurai, it's more complicated than that.

snippet.textDisplay:
You can feel the undertones of Tenchu just in the music.

Aquire has often made clunky, budget-like games that have interesting depth and enjoyment to them.

And amazing music, Tenchu: Birth of the Silent Assassins not included due to the severe lack of music in most stages.
snippet.textOriginal:
You can feel the undertones of Tenchu just in the music.

Aquire has often made clunky, budget-like games that have interesting depth and enjoyment to them.

And amazing music, Tenchu: Birth of the Silent Assassins not included due to the severe lack of music in most stages.

snippet.textDisplay: I felt myself begin to tear up at the Akadama ending. Even more, until I bought it today, I always got the ending where you, Suzu and  Kurikichi leave. It felt so terrible when I read her final words 'This would have been the perfect ending if everybody hadn't died.' Only now do I truely realize what she meant. Today, I got the ending where you, Suzu, Kurikichi, Don, Dojima and Tsubohachi leave the pass. It was the best ending I ever saw and felt so happy for them(is this really only a gameLOL).
snippet.textOriginal: I felt myself begin to tear up at the Akadama ending. Even more, until I bought it today, I always got the ending where you, Suzu and  Kurikichi leave. It felt so terrible when I read her final words 'This would have been the perfect ending if everybody hadn't died.' Only now do I truely realize what she meant. Today, I got the ending where you, Suzu, Kurikichi, Don, Dojima and Tsubohachi leave the pass. It was the best ending I ever saw and felt so happy for them(is this really only a gameLOL).
